availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

creation.placeName: New York, New York County, New York

body.p:
State of New York
City and County of New York ss

I, John Butcher of the City, County and State of New York having been appointed Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky in New York do hereby Solemnly swear that I will support the constitution of the United States and the Constitution of the State of Kentucky. That I will faithfully discharge the duties of such commissioner according to the best of my ability and, that the following is a correct impression of my official seal and signature attached

John Butcher
Commisioner for the State of Kentucky residing in the City, County and State of New York
Subscribed and Sworn to before me this 15th day of April 1865

Gilbert O. F. Nicole
Notary Public

figure.ab:
GILBERT O. F. NICOLE
NOTARY PUBLIC

body.p:
Comr of Deeds for New York
Oath of John Butcher
Filed
20th Apl/65
